title: Text Styling
desc: Text styling in CSS is essential for creating visually appealing web content. just take a look into the most important properties you can use to style text.

properties.name: color
properties.desc: Sets the color of the text.

properties.name: font-family
properties.desc: Specifies the font of the text.

properties.name: font-size
properties.desc: Defines the size of the text.

properties.name: font-weight
properties.desc: Sets the thickness of the text.

properties.name: font-style
properties.desc: Applies styles like italic or oblique.

properties.name: font-variant
properties.desc: Controls the text appearance in small-caps.

properties.name: line-height
properties.desc: Adjusts the height of each line of text.

properties.name: text-transform
properties.desc: Alters the case of the text.

properties.name: text-decoration
properties.desc: Adds decoration to text, like underlining.

properties.name: text-indent
properties.desc: Indents the first line of a paragraph.

properties.name: text-shadow
properties.desc: Adds a shadow effect to text.

properties.name: word-wrap
properties.desc: Allows long words to break and wrap onto the next line.

properties.name: text-overflow
properties.desc: Specifies how overflowed content that is not displayed is signaled to the user.

properties.name: viewport units
properties.desc: Use vw or vh for responsive font sizes.

properties.name: Media Queries
properties.desc: Adjust font size or style based on screen size.
